titlestmt.sponsor: This collection-level EAD record is a product of the Philadelphia Area Consortium of Special Collections Libraries (PACSCL) Consortial Survey Initiative, which was funded by the Andrew W. Mellon Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: Machine-readable finding aid generated in EAD from data in the PACSCL Consortial Survey Database on 12/21/2012. Modified by Dot Porter in 2017.

bioghist.p: David Smith Lytle (1847-1899) was a missionary in India. He died of dysentery in 1899 after 18 years of service.

scopecontent.p: This is a photo album of pictures taken in and around Sialkot, in the northeast of the Punjab province in Pakistan. Subjects are landscapes, groups portraits, and mission buildings, including the Christian Training Institute and the American Mission Memorial Hospital and Dispensary. The album includes a photo of the hospital while it was under construction.

accessrestrict.p: Access to this collection is restricted; please contact the holding institution for details.

relatedmaterial.p: Related material may be found in the following collections: Presbyterian Historical Society: Kate Alexander Hill papers (accession 96 1003).
